flawed_nl_solution:
First find the total number of degrees the candy needs to heat up: 240 degrees - 60 degrees = <<240-60=810>>810 degrees
Then divide that amount by the rate the candy heats up: 810 degrees / 5 degrees/minute = <<810/5=162>>162 minutes
Then find the number of degrees the candy needs to cool down: 240 degrees - 170 degrees = <<240-170=70>>70 degrees
Then divide that by the rate the candy cool down: 70 degrees / 7 degrees/minute = <<70/7=10>>10 minutes
Then add the time for the candy to heat to the time for it to cool to find the total time: 10 minutes + 162 minutes = <<10+162=172>>172 minutes
#### 172

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 180, not 810. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
